Name: (R) Ref. Case Non-NG Heat&AC
Description: Ref. case fuel oil/propane/biomass heating w/ central AC
Baseline Technology: boiler (distillate); furnace (distillate); furnace (kerosene); furnace (LPG); central AC
Installed Cost: boiler (distillate)-5510; furnace (distillate)-5150; furnace (kerosene)-5150; furnace (LPG)-5150; central AC-5320
Cost Source Notes: Typical total installed cost in 2022, average of range where applicable, CAC North
Cost Source Details: Updated Buildings Sector Appliance and Equipment Costs and Efficiencies - Appendix A; U.S. Energy Information Admnistration; 2023; 14,20,27; https://www.eia.gov/analysis/studies/buildings/equipcosts/pdf/full.pdf
Lifetime: boiler (distillate)-23; furnace (distillate)-26.5; furnace (kerosene)-26.5; furnace (LPG)-26.5; central AC-18
Lifetime Source Details:
Updated Buildings Sector Appliance and Equipment Costs and Efficiencies - Appendix A; U.S. Energy Information Admnistration; 2023; 14,20,27; https://www.eia.gov/analysis/studies/buildings/equipcosts/pdf/full.pdf
Updated Buildings Sector Appliance and Equipment Costs and Efficiencies - Appendix A; U.S. Energy Information Admnistration; 2023; 14,20,27; https://www.eia.gov/analysis/studies/buildings/equipcosts/pdf/full.pdf
Market Scaling Source Notes: Central AC cooling multiple of 68% was determined as a proportion of total homes with a ducted cooling system where heating is done using any non-electric heating energy source. Total homes with ducted cooling (main air conditioning equipment type = central AC = 1) in the sample is 12,211 homes, and then filtered for homes with non-electric heating system (Main space heating fuel != electricity = 5) 12,211-3,949 homes
Market Scaling Source Details: RECS 2020 Microdata; U.S. Energy Information Administration; 2023; NA; https://www.eia.gov/consumption/residential/data/2020/index.php?view=microdata
